_header: Alas what thing can be more grievous pain
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 111.
Subjects: love, vicissitudes of; absence, pangs of
_description: The pangs of absence — six stanzas rhyme royal

BodRawC813.First Lines:
Alas what thing can be more grevous paynevnto the hartes moste
                    desire and wyll…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…a more truer louer were not possyble to fyndeThen I whyche am
                    yours vnto my lyves ende
BodRawC813.Editions:
Padelford,  Frederick Morgan. 
             “Liedersammlungen des xvi. Jahrhunderts…IV.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 309-96: 327-8.
Jansen,  Sharon L.,  and  Kathleen H. Jordan, eds.  
             The Welles Anthology: MS. Rawlinson C.813: A Critical Edition.
         Binghamton, NY: Medieval & Renaissance Texts and Studies,
            1991: 114-16.
